title: USC blows 18-point lead against Washington & spoils perfect season
description: LOS ANGELES, CA -- A tale of two halves was on full display Saturday evening at the Galen Center as the undefeated USC Trojans Men's Basketball team found themselves up by 18 at halftime against the Washington Huskies, but were unable to close it out as the Trojans would drop their Big Ten home opener, thus spoiling their perfect season by a final score of 84-76.

title: Contenders plot path to 2026 World Cup glory after Trump steals show at draw
description: The path to glory at the 2026 World Cup has now been laid out after the contenders discovered their tournament fate at Friday's draw ceremony in Washington which was dominated by Donald Trump.The US President received FIFA's new peace prize on stage at the Kennedy Center prior to the draw for the first 48-team World Cup, which offered kind starts to the tournament for holders Argentina and much-fancied Spain in particular.

title: Trump and Infantino - too close for comfort?
description: Friday’s World Cup draw in Washington DC will be the latest illustration of the ever-closer relationship between US President Donald Trump and Fifa president Gianni Infantino.

title: Judge issues injunction restricting immigration arrests in nation's capital
description: A federal judge late Tuesday blocked the Trump administration from making widespread immigration arrests in the nation’s capital without warrants or probable cause that the person is an imminent flight risk.  U.S. District Judge Beryl Howell in Washington granted a preliminary injunction sought by civil liberties and immigrants rights groups in a lawsuit against the U.S.

title: Trump 'garbage' rhetoric about Somalis draws cheers from administration, silence from Republicans and alarm from critics
description: (This story contains language some readers may find offensive) By Bianca Flowers, James Oliphant, David Hood-Nuño and Joseph Ax WASHINGTON, Dec 4 (Reuters) - During a closed-door White House meeting

title: Ferdinand to conduct World Cup draw with sporting greats
description: Rio Ferdinand will conduct Friday's World Cup draw in Washington DC alongside a host of sporting greats, including Tom Brady, Wayne Gretzky, Aaron Judge and Shaquille O'Neal.

title: US lawmakers to force vote on war powers if Trump attacks Venezuela
description: By Patricia Zengerle WASHINGTON, Dec 2 (Reuters) - A group of U.S. senators who have tried repeatedly to rein in President Donald Trump's aggression against Venezuela said on Tuesday they would file a

title: China’s ByteDance could be forced to sell TikTok U.S., but its quiet lead in AI will help it survive—and maybe even thrive
description: ByteDance, the owner of TikTok and target of Washington ire, operates China’s most popular chatbot, Doubao.

title: WSU falls short in rock fight against Bradley, 64-60
description: The Washington State Cougars fell short of an impressive road win, losing to the Bradley Braves 64-60. In a super close contest that never saw either team lead by more than nine points, Bradley (5-4) was able to squeak out a win at home in the closing minute with a go-ahead bucket with 19 seconds […]

title: Denver Broncos do something that hasn't happened in nearly 40 years in win over Commanders
description: The Denver Broncos made some history in their win over the Washington Commanders.

title: A co-host on the show said Japanese soldiers were “convicted and executed” for killing Americans in the water.
description: Secretary of Defense Pete Hegseth could be in trouble legally over allegedly greenlighting a double-tap on a Venezuelan boat, Morning Joe hosts have claimed. It comes after a Washington Post article cited sources with direct knowledge of the operation who said Hegseth’s “order was to kill everybody.” Former Republican congressman Joe Scarborough claimed the so-called ‘Secretary of War’ could be in a “dangerous” position with the law, if allegations are true.

title: Lawmakers sound alarm over report on Hegseth’s boat strike order — ‘This rises to the level of a war crime if it’s true’
description: The Washington Post reported that Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth issued a verbal order for all crew members to be killed as part of a Sept. 2 attack.

title: The S&P 500 could hit 7,000 this week, while Trump hints at a Fed chair pick and Washington eyes this special election
description: "The S&P 500 would need to rise by just 2.2% to reach 7,000. That could happen this coming week, in our view."

title: Broncos-Commanders umpire Mark Pellis sidelined with calf injury
description: The rest of the fourth quarter of Sunday night's matchup between Denver and Washington will be played with one fewer official on the field.

title: Broncos vs. Commanders live score, updates, highlights from NFL 'Sunday Night Football' game
description: The Denver Broncos will take on the Washington Commanders for Week 13's "Sunday Night Football" game. Follow along as The Sporting News tracks the scores, updates and highlights LIVE.

title: Trump says he'll release MRI results; he doesn't know what part of his body was scanned
description: President Donald Trump said Sunday that he would release the results of his MRI test that he received in October.  “If you want to have it released, I’ll release it,” the president said during an exchange with reporters as he traveled back to Washington from Florida.  The White House has so far declined to detail why Trump had an MRI during his physical last month, or on what part of his body.

title: 7 major takeaways from Oregon Ducks' 26-14 win over Washington Huskies
description: The Oregon Ducks went up to Seattle and walked away with an impressive 26-14 win, clinching a spot in the College Football Playoff.

title: Scientists solve the mystery of the prehistoric 'Burtele Foot'
description: By Will Dunham WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Scientists have solved the mystery of 3.4 million-year-old fossils called the "Burtele Foot" discovered in Ethiopia in 2009, finding they belonged to an enigmatic

title: The five-time draft dodger used a tragic announcement to complain about how he doesn’t get enough credit.
description: President Donald Trump went wildly off script in a call with U.S. military service members conducted during his Thanksgiving holiday at Mar-a-Lago. Trump, 79, bluntly broke the news of the death of Army Specialist Sarah Beckstrom, the National Guard member who was shot near Farragut Square Metro Station in Washington, D.C.

title: Alex Ovechkin stays hot to lift Capitals 4-3 over Jets
description: Alex Ovechkin scored his 908th career NHL goal and the Washington Capitals beat the Winnipeg Jets 4-3 on Wednesday night.  John Carlson, Jakob Chychrun and Connor McMichael also scored for the Capitals, winners of five of the last six.  Charlie Lindgren had 18 saves in the win.

title: Trump's Ukraine plan triggers outrage from Republican lawmakers
description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -Several congressional Republicans are harshly criticizing President Donald Trump's White House over its handling of a proposed Ukraine peace plan they say favors Russia, a sharp departure for a party that has adhered closely to almost all ​of Trump's initiatives. Backers of Ukraine have worried that a U.

title: Pentagon threatens to prosecute Senator Mark Kelly by recalling him to Navy service
description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -The Pentagon on Monday threatened to recall Senator Mark Kelly, a retired Navy captain, to active duty status in order to prosecute him after saying it received "serious

title: Trump seizes control of Republicans' 2026 election strategy with his presidency on the line
description: By Nandita Bose and Tim Reid WASHINGTON (Reuters) -President Donald Trump isn't on the ballot in next November's midterm elections, but he’s plunging into them with his own presidency at stake.

title: Tyler Herro scores 24 in season debut as Heat edge Mavericks 106-102
description: Tyler Herro scored 24 points in his season debut after recovering from ankle surgery, Kel’el Ware had 20 points and 18 rebounds, and the Miami Heat held off the Dallas Mavericks 106-102 on Monday night.  Bam Adebayo had 17 points for Miami, which was held nearly 20 points below its season average but improved to 8-1 at home.  P.J. Washington scored 27 points for Dallas, which got 15 from Max Christie, 13 from Klay Thompson and 12 apiece from Cooper Flagg and Brandon Williams.

title: US civil rights leader Jesse Jackson released from Chicago hospital, family says
description: By Steve Gorman WASHINGTON (Reuters) -U.S. civil rights leader Jesse Jackson was released on Monday from a Chicago hospital where he had been receiving medical care for at least 12 days, according to

title: Trump's ACA reforms could be worse than losing subsidies: Analyst
description: President Trump is reportedly considering extending the Affordable Care Act (ACA) subsidies, conditional on significant reforms. Raymond James managing director and Washington health policy research analyst, Chris Meekins, joins Market Domination Overtime to discuss the reported changes and what they could mean for the healthcare industry. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

title: US judge tosses case against ex-FBI chief Comey, rebuking Trump prosecutor
description: By Andrew Goudsward WASHINGTON (Reuters) -A U.S. judge on Monday tossed out criminal charges against former FBI Director James Comey based on a procedural error, an extraordinary setback for the

title: Exclusive-US to launch new phase of Venezuela operations, sources say
description: By Phil Stewart and Idrees Ali WASHINGTON (Reuters) -The United States is poised to launch a new phase of Venezuela-related operations in the coming days, four U.S. officials told Reuters, as the

title: First SpaceX booster for upgraded Starship fails during test in Texas
description: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -A towering first-stage booster for an upgraded version of SpaceX's Starship rocket suffered a predawn testing failure in Texas on ​Friday, potentially complicating the company's push to prove the rocket's moon-landing abilities ‌for NASA, according to observers who captured it on video. Elon Musk's SpaceX had rolled the stainless steel booster out to ‌a testing pad on Thursday at the company's Starbase rocket facilities, saying it intended to test its redesigned propellant

title: Two-minute drill: Washington State's keys to victory against No. 21 James Madison
description: Nov. 21—Here is what to watch for when Washington State takes on No. 21 James Madison at 10 a.m. on Saturday.

title: Things to watch: EWU's starting quarterback for finale still unclear
description: Nov. 21—Eastern Washington head coach Aaron Best likes to point out that a football team's win-loss record is an imperfect tool in discerning just how well that team has played. Cal Poly, the Eagles' opponent at 2 p.m. Saturday in San Luis Obispo, Calif.

title: WSU to try and spoil No. 21 James Madison's CFP race in road matchup
description: Nov. 21—When his Washington State club is looking at another long flight, headed to another part of the country to play a team from another walk of life, Tucker Large doesn't get too creative. While some teammates might watch movies or listen to music, the veteran safety likes to keep things businesslike. "The last couple of fights I've really just downloaded film," Large said. As the Cougars ...

title: The pick: Why No. 21 James Madison will beat Washington State
description: Nov. 21—Only a few minutes after his Washington State team fell apart in the fourth quarter of a loss to Virginia, which came about a month ago, coach Jimmy Rogers sat at a table and discussed the result with reporters. The crowd noise had clearly bothered the Cougars, who committed five penalties in the fourth quarter alone, leading to a late collapse. "The speakers must not be loud enough," ...

title: US Warship Cuts Path of Russian Tanker Headed to Venezuela
description: A sanctioned Russian oil tanker made a U-turn on the way to Venezuela after a US warship intersected its route near the country’s coast, according to Bloomberg tanker tracking, raising questions about whether Washington could step in to curtail Moscow’s energy aid to Caracas.

title: Judge criticizes federal prosecutors for relying on testimony by officer with credibility concerns
description: A federal judge ruled Thursday that police in the nation’s capital illegally seized a gun from a man they stopped outside a laundromat, blasting the officers’ account as unreliable and sharply criticizing Justice Department prosecutors for relying on testimony from an officer who has been discredited by other judges.  The ruling comes at a moment when policing in Washington, D.C., is under an extraordinary spotlight, with the city grappling with rising public scrutiny of officer misconduct and the Trump administration directing a surge of federal law enforcement resources into the district earlier this year.  U.

title: China imports no US soybeans for second month, Brazil arrivals up 29%
description: BEIJING () -China imported no soybeans from the U. for a second straight month in October even as total imports surged to ​a record high on purchases from South America, with buyers aiming to avert ‌supply disruptions amid trade tensions with Washington.

title: Ukraine firmly rejects any border changes under US peace plan
description: Ukraine's ambassador to the United States has firmly ruled out any border changes in the country in response to a US peace plan to end the war launched by Russia nearly four years ago. "The territorial integrity of Ukraine and the changing of Ukrainian borders is not something which should be put on the table," Olha Stefanishyna said during a roundtable discussion in Washington on Thursday evening.
